AzureBlade sighed heavily. At least the other seemed to have
understood the point.

AzureBlade: Concentrate on Crushing the Tripreds for now. They're the
most likely to send a backup force here, and the biggest one too.
Destroy their communication array and you avoid that.

He stood up then went for the exit, but stopped halfway.

AzureBlade: By the way, you asked how I could deal with Maximals as
well as with Predacons. The answer is simple; they are both my people.
Look at my spark signature and you'll know it's true. The situation
away from Cybertron is so dangerous that only a handful of Predacons
or maximals refuse to act in concert, and even less fight against each
other. I will go for now, but you can call me if you need help or
anything else. It was an honor meeting you.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Hydras:
> 
> Hydras meditated taht words. By now he didn't like to say anything 
> 
>

> > AzureBlade: Of course I do! 
> > 
> > His tone raised clearly and his temper reached a summit. How could a
> > Predacon leader be so stupid?
> > 
> > AzureBlade: You are currently playing the ostrich and trying not to
> > see the obvious. Continue with that agenda and you'll be dead in 
> just
> > a few megacycles. You can not destroy the maximals and gain anything
> > because THEY HAVE NOTHING LEFT! The Tripredacus have utterly 
> conquered
> > Cybertron and as we speak, they are securing the colonies they have
> > just invaded. Compared to them, you are a puny insect! Don't you
> > understand that if you wear yourself down against the Maximals, 
> you'll
> > be swallowed by the greater threat?
